Posts.Content: Thanks HighlanderCFH. We have no control over who we see but IF I see the lead person (not always possible) he is the senior clinical lead person in radiotherapy. The NHS have denied surgery. Anyway, a very good question to ask about spread.

Posts.Title: Drop in PSA

Posts.Content: Im reading Dr Walshs book and cant make sense of HT for bone metastasis. Heres some quotes... If you have metastases to bone, bone pain, or a large mass of cancer that is obstructing your kidneys or bladder, you need to start hormonal therapy now. In this situation, hormonal therapy is the right course of actionone that can make a huge, vital difference in your quality of life and can protect your body from the ravages of cancer. Also, you should select some form of treatment that will drive your blood testosterone to the lowest level. Again, the cancer cells that ultimately prove fatal in prostate cancer are the hormone-insensitive cells. So...I cant see from the book why or how it can make a huge, vital difference etc.. Can someone please point me in the right direction. Many thanks.
